channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: BBC apologizes for edit of Trump speech but says it won't provide legal compensation
item.description: The BBC has apologized to President Trump for the way it edited his Jan. 6, 2021 speech but says it won't pay compensation. Trump has threatened a $1 ...

item.title: 'Much more than a job': Food bank workers reflect on the joy they find in their work
item.description: Cyndi Kirkhart and Scott Thompson of the Facing Hunger Food Bank in Huntington, West Virginia, talk about how they met and the rewards of feeding the ...

item.title: Unlike the government, the quiz never stopped. Can you ace this week's test?
item.description: This week's quiz is mercifully light on politics, unless you count President James Garfield, a Kennedy family member and a new House rep … OK, so it's...

item.title: As social media grows more toxic, college athletes ask themselves: Is it worth it?
item.description: Building a social media brand has helped enrich players. But constant harassment — fueled in part by sports gambling — has come to outweigh potential ...

item.title: Economic promises helped Trump get elected. Now he has an affordability problem
item.description: Americans are feeling the strain of high prices, even as President Trump tries to tout "record highs" in the stock market.

item.title: Calif. wildfire forces evacuations as storm threatens mudslides in south
item.description: A Pacific storm could help California crews battle the dangerous Pack Fire in Mono County, but it could also wreak havoc on fire-charred communities f...

item.title: Australian schools shut over asbestos risk in children's sand
item.description: The Australian regulator has recalled several sand products used by children for play, but says the risk from them is "low".

item.title: BBC apologises to Trump over Panorama edit but refuses to pay compensation
item.description: Lawyers for the US president have threatened to sue the corporation for $1bn (£759m).

item.title: Russian drone slams into block of flats in deadly wave of strikes across Kyiv
item.description: Six areas of the capital are hit, and a further attack on a market in the south kills two others.

item.title: Latest opioid settlement plan with OxyContin maker Purdue and Sackler family getting few objections
Freed British-Egyptian activist not allowed to fly to UK, family says
item.description: Mr Abdel Fattah was Egypt's best known political prisoner until seven weeks ago, when he was released from jail.

item.title: Epstein emails reveal enduring ties with influential figures even after his sex crime conviction
11/13: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: House to vote on Epstein files next week as White House tells GOP "don't be fooled" over email release; New book explores Russia's short-lived victory...

item.title: FDA's plan to boost cheaper copycat drugs could stall at patent office
item.description: The FDA's push for lower-cost medicines looks good on paper, but the patent office under President Trump may be going in the opposite direction.

item.title: Suspected food poisoning kills mom, 2 kids at popular tourist site
item.description: Two children and their mother have died after eating street food at a popular Istanbul tourist site, Turkish officials said.

item.title: She wanted to keep her son in his school district. It was more challenging than it seemed
item.description: When families are evicted, kids’ schooling is often disrupted. Many evicted families go from living in a school district that spends more money on stu...

item.title: Swiss hope to slash crippling Trump tariffs after golden charm offensive
item.description: Swiss ministers have had "very positive" talks in Washington, but a private business visit to the Oval Office may have made all the difference.
